sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Brazil's President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva promises to end an era of devastation in a first day in office filled with symbolism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ex-Pope Benedict XVI's body will be moved to St. Peter's Basilica from his monastery and will lie in state for three days ahead of his funeral on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians face a grim start to 2023 following more Russian missile and drone attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, a U.S. think tank says Russian ammunition stocks are running low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Fighting back tears and breaking with some of the traditions, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has been sworn in as Brazil's president for the third time on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a busy day with a number of official duties, Lula and his team made sure the first day in office was filled with symbolism. His first stop was the Parliament, where he spoke in front of lawmakers and representatives from other countries gathered in the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There Lula declared what he called the end of the worst periods in Brazilian history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Democracy was the great victory in this election, overcoming the greatest mobilization of public and private resources ever seen by the opposition, the most violent threats to the freedom of the people, the most abject campaign of lies and hatred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Plots to manipulate and embarrass the Brazilian electorate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Never before have state resources been so distorted in favor of an authoritarian project of power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Lula also spoke of ending devastation and said those guilty of crimes against the nation will eventually be punished, without mentioning his predecessor's name directly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The energised left-wing president took the opportunity to showcase a new phase of reconciliation, environmental preservation and social justice on his return to power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people are expected to pay their respects to former Pope Benedict XVI as a period of lying in state begins ahead of his funeral on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Benedict's body was displayed on Sunday in a chapel of the Vatican monastery where he lived but from today it will be on view in St. Peter's Basilica for those who wish to pay tribute to him in person.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Catholics in Paris have given their opinion of the Pope, who broke with tradition and stood down due to poor health more than a decade ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Benedict had a mixed reputation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He was regarded as an unrivalled theologian, but attracted critics for his failures to recognise and act on the scale of sexual abuse within the global Roman Catholic Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He was nothing like John Paul II, this rector says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But succeeding John Paul II, what can you do?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He did so humbly, like a man serving God's vineyard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He did it with what he had, his talents, notably his theology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I was always impressed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This might make you laugh. You always felt smarter when you were listening to him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He could make you understand the mystery of faith with simple words.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I thought he was too old-fashioned and not the right direction for the Catholic Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But it's sad. He was the leader, so...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Benedict's funeral will be held in St. Peter's Square and will be a simple, solemn and sober ceremony in keeping with his wishes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian capital Kyiv came under renewed shelling on Sunday night, according to the city's mayor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There were reports of explosions in the centre center but no indication of any casualties. It follows an earlier wave of Russian strikes on New Year's Day, when air raid sirens wailed across the country just after midnight, putting an end to New Year's celebrations however muted. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Sunday night that his country's forces had downed 45 Iranian-built drones launched by Russia on the first day of 2023, showing that Ukraine's air defenses were working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia's defense ministry said it had targeted a military industrial complex involved in the production of drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: U.S. think tank the Institute for the Study of War says Russian forces will struggle to keep pace on the front line as ammunition stocks are running low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It claims resources could dry up as early as March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As COVID-19 cases surge in China, European nations are tightening their security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: From Sunday, travelers arriving in France from China have been required to wear a surgical mask and have agreed to undergo random PCR tests on arrival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France's Minister of Health and Prevention says this allows them to better monitor the disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He told reporters that this control on arrival is not a control intended to prevent citizens from entering the territory, but is a more scientific control that allows us to follow the different variants in a precise way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These are essentially Omicron variants that are currently in China." Amid mounting concern at the situation in China, Francois Braun says he wants other European countries to introduce similar practices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said France is having a discussion at the European level this week to harmonize this model of care.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Spanish and Italians have already taken these measures, he said, as have the Americans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: France will push this methodology to be adopted by all European Union countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: From Thursday, passengers from China will also have to present a negative PCR or antigen test from the last 48 hours. Since Beijing's zero-Covid policy was lifted, hospitals have been overwhelmed, with mostly elderly and vulnerable patients who have received little or no vaccination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The 1st of January 2023 marked the start of a new era for Croatia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With its accession to the Schengen area confirmed, border controls were abolished and the kuna was replaced by the euro as the country's national currency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, visited Zagreb to mark the occasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A small crowd gathered in the city's main square to watch von der Leyen having a coffee with Croatian Prime Minister Andrei Plenkovich and then paying in euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Residents here seem happy about the change, with many looking forward to hassle-free travel in and out of neighboring countries. This is very good for all Croatian people for all Europe yes of course because we wait always one two hours on the border to cross the border and now it's it's perfect yes we like this it's very good. And it's good news for visitors too. The change in currency means it's one less thing to worry about for most European tourists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I am from the Netherlands so every time I come here I had to exchange from euros to kunas and now I don't have to do that so it's very nice and I think that since Croatia is already part of the European Union it just makes everything a lot easier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Sunday von der Leyen, Plankovich and Slovenian President Natasha Piase Musa held a joint press conference at a key border crossing between Croatia and Slovenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The next generation of Croatians will grow up in Schengen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People will be able to travel freely, business will be unhindered by checks. Seamless travel will bring tangible results for people living along the border, working across the border or having family on both sides of the border. Croatia is the first country to join the Schengen zone in 11 years, but it could also mean a heightening of security along its borders with non-EU nations like Bosnia and Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The border between Slovenia and Croatia is 670 kilometers long, and the press conference was held at its busiest point, about 10 kilometers from Zagreb.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In 2019, the last year before the pandemic, 29 million people were registered at the border crossings between the two countries.

sentences.sentence: These yoga enthusiasts are honing their skills while practicing alongside downward-facing dogs.
